description_txt: stated on April 12, 2011 in a blog post.:
quote_txt: George Allen voted to add $3 trillion to the federal debt, voted to raise the debt ceiling four times and voted for the No Child Left Behind Act while he was a senator.

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2011 in a billboard message spotted in Austin.:
quote_txt: "A DWI costs $17,000."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: "The Republicans have demanded deep cuts in education. They've demanded cuts in cancer research and other research to find cures and treatments to diseases."

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2011 in an opinion article in the 'Wall Street Journal':
quote_txt: To pay for government growth, leaders of both parties "borrowed $4 billion a day, leaving us with today's $14 trillion debt."

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2011 in an interview:
quote_txt: "When we lower tax rates, we generate more in revenues. That happened in '86 with the Reagan plan, happened in 2001, following the Bush plan."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2011 in an online petition:
quote_txt: "For every [coyote] they kill, the population will replace and usually multiply."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in a speech at George Washington University:
quote_txt: "In the last decade, the average income of the bottom 90 percent of all working Americans actually declined. The top 1 percent saw their income rise by an average of more than a quarter of a million dollars each."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in a speech:
quote_txt: "By the end of this decade, the interest we owe on our debt could rise to nearly $1 trillion."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2011 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Says "Congressman Eric Cantor wants to eliminate Social Security."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2010 in a letter from the Ohio congressional delegation to NASA:
quote_txt: A space shuttle the National Museum of the United States Air Force near Dayton would be "within a day's drive of 60 percent of the U.S. population."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2011 in an interview on "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: A Republican proposal changes Medicare for those under age 55 so that they will  "participate in the same kind of health plan that members of Congress do."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "Foreign aid makes up about 1 percent of our entire budget."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2011 in his book, "Courage to Stand: An American Story":
quote_txt: President Obama has "stopped using the phrase 'war on terror.' "

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2011 in an announcement of an application for federal stimulus money for rail:
quote_txt: On federal stimulus money for expanding rail service.

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2011 in a campaign-style ad.:
quote_txt: "Politicians and their corporate lobbyists are trying to take away my right to spend my paycheck how I want."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2011 in a campaign-style ad.:
quote_txt: Says unions "take away" hard-earned money of teachers, firefighters and police officers to play politics.

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2011 in a speech before Congress:
quote_txt: Says the federal government borrows "almost $60 billion per week."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Today" show:
quote_txt: President Obama has spent over $2 million in legal fees defending lawsuits about his birth certificate.

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2011 in a newsletter.:
quote_txt: A cap-and-trade bill would "destroy over 50,000 jobs in Virginia."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2011 in his book, "Courage to Stand: An American Story":
quote_txt: "In 2009, we cut state spending in real terms for the first time in 150 years."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2011 in picket signs at a parade.:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Rick Scott lost Florida 331,247 jobs.

description_txt: stated on February 23, 2011 in a discussion at a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "The benefits that were offered to me as a congressman don’t even compare to the benefits that you get as a state employee. I just experienced that myself. They’re not nearly as good."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2011 in a meeting with The Atlanta Journal-Constitution editorial board:
quote_txt: "There used to be 16 workers for every one person on Social Security. ... Now it’s three."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in his State of the State speech:
quote_txt: There was "some sort of informal commitment to build a (psychiatric) building in downtown Cleveland."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2011 in a press release.:
quote_txt: On the way the federal government should spend Florida's rejected high-speed rail money.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2011 in in a press release:
quote_txt: "For every one ESD superintendent position, we can pay for three speech pathologists, or three special needs instructors, or three classroom teachers."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2011 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "Libya supplies the oil for China. We get no oil from Libya."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2011 in comments during an appearance on 'The Rachel Maddow Show' on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "We have a guy who is going to be speaker of the House in four years, and his name has been on the ballot one time."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2011 in an email blast to supporters:
quote_txt: The newly proposed House Republican budget "abolishes Medicare within 10 years."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2011 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "Over the past decade, the big five oil companies --- BP, Chevron, ConocoPhillips, ExxonMobil and Shell -- made a total profit of nearly $1 trillion."
